rule.name: Field Existence Checking with $jazz.has()
rule.description: Use `$jazz.has("field")` NOT `!obj.field` to check if optional fields exist. Optional fields may be unloaded but exist in the database.
rule.rationale: Checking with !obj.field can return false for unloaded fields, leading to data loss when re-initializing them
rule.instructions: Always use `$jazz.has("field")` to check if optional fields exist before initializing them. Never use truthiness checks on optional fields.

rule.name: ensureLoaded After upsertUnique
rule.description: After `upsertUnique`, always `ensureLoaded` before checking optional fields.
rule.rationale: upsertUnique may return partially loaded objects. Checking fields without loading leads to false negatives.
rule.instructions: Always call ensureLoaded after upsertUnique with the appropriate resolve structure before accessing optional fields.

rule.name: Check $isLoaded Before Using Jazz API
rule.description: Always check `obj.$isLoaded` before calling `obj.$jazz.set()`, `obj.$jazz.owner`, or other Jazz API methods. TypeScript cannot infer that these properties exist on unloaded objects.
rule.rationale: Jazz objects can be in NotLoaded state where $jazz API is not available. TypeScript will error if you try to access $jazz properties without checking $isLoaded first.
rule.instructions: - Always check `$isLoaded` before accessing `$jazz` API methods - Use `obj?.$isLoaded` checks or `ensureLoaded()` to guarantee objects are loaded - TypeScript will not let you access $jazz properties on possibly-unloaded objects - This prevents runtime errors from calling methods on NotLoaded objects

rule.name: Lazy Loading Lists Level-by-Level
rule.description: Jazz CoLists must be loaded explicitly at each level. Nested $each does NOT load list items - it only resolves nested data IF items are already loaded.
rule.rationale: Common misconception that $each loads the list. It doesn't - you must explicitly load each list level.
rule.instructions: Load lists explicitly level-by-level. Use $each only to resolve nested data on already-loaded list items, not to load the list itself.

rule.name: ensureLoaded is Async
rule.description: Always await ensureLoaded calls. They are asynchronous operations.

examples.example: await player.$jazz.ensureLoaded({ resolve: { rounds: true } }); // MUST await

rule.instructions: Never forget to await ensureLoaded() calls. Missing await can cause race conditions and unloaded data access.

rule.name: Never Store Jazz Objects in React State
rule.description: NEVER store Jazz CoValues (Game, Player, etc.) in React state (useState, useContext). Store IDs instead.
rule.rationale: Jazz objects are reactive and update references as nested data loads. Storing them in React state causes excessive re-renders (20-40+) as each progressive load creates a new reference, triggering React's change detection.

performance_impact.before: 24+ re-renders over 3+ seconds as nested data loads
performance_impact.after: 1 render when selector returns fully loaded data

rule.instructions: - Store IDs (strings) in React state/context, NEVER Jazz objects - Use useCoState directly in components that need the data - Let Jazz's reactivity handle updates, not React's state system - Use selectors in useCoState to control when components re-render

rule.name: Avoid React Hooks with Jazz Data
rule.description: Minimize useState, useMemo, useEffect with Jazz data. Use Jazz hooks and functions instead.
rule.rationale: Jazz provides reactive data updates. Wrapping Jazz in React patterns creates unnecessary complexity, bugs, and performance issues.

react_patterns_to_avoid.pattern: Never store Jazz objects in state
Only for expensive computations, not simple data access
Don't sync Jazz data in effects - use selectors instead
Only for event handlers, never for Jazz data access

rule.instructions: - Use Jazz's reactive data system directly with useCoState - Use selectors to control when data is "ready" - Only use useState for truly local UI state (modals, form inputs, toggles) - Only use useEffect for side effects (navigation, API calls), not data syncing - For simple data access, just access Jazz data directly - no useMemo needed - For expensive computations on Jazz data, see "Selectors vs useMemo for Expensive Operations" rule

rule.name: Keep High-Level Subscriptions Shallow
rule.description: High-level components that stay mounted (navigators, screens) should NOT deeply resolve nested objects in subscriptions. Let child components load their own data.
rule.rationale: Deep resolution in high-level subscriptions causes "value is unavailable" errors during progressive loading. When a parent component subscribes deeply (e.g., course.name, tee.holes), it tries to access partially loaded nested data during Jazz's progressive loading cycle, triggering errors when toString() is called on CoValueLoadingState.

pattern.principle: Child components: Load their own deep data asynchronously
Use useEffect + ensureLoaded in child components
Check $jazz.has("field") before loading optional nested fields

rule.instructions: - High-level components (navigators, screens) should only resolve shallow data - Never resolve nested objects deeply (course.name, tee.holes) in high-level subscriptions - Create child components that load their own nested data using useEffect + ensureLoaded - This prevents accessing partially loaded data during progressive loading - Pattern: Parent subscribes shallow, children load deep asynchronously

rule.name: Modify Entities from Authoritative Source
rule.description: Always modify entities from the authoritative source (e.g., game context), not from stale references.

examples.example: const { player } = route.params; player.rounds.$jazz.push(newRound);
const gamePlayer = game.players.find(p => p?.$jazz.id === player.$jazz.id); gamePlayer.rounds.$jazz.push(newRound);

rule.instructions: Always retrieve the current version of an entity from its authoritative context before modification to avoid working with stale references.

rule.name: Creating CoMaps with Optional Fields
rule.description: When creating CoMaps, pass only required fields to `.create()`. Set optional fields AFTER creation.
rule.rationale: Jazz .create() expects plain values, not CoMap instances. Passing CoMaps in initial value causes "right operand of 'in' is not an object" errors.
rule.instructions: Create CoMaps with only required primitive fields. Use $jazz.set() to add optional fields, especially if they are other CoMaps.

rule.name: Use Selectors to Control Re-renders
rule.description: Use the `select` option in useCoState to batch updates and prevent re-renders during progressive loading.
rule.rationale: Jazz loads nested data progressively. Without selectors, components re-render on every nested data load (20-40+ times). Selectors let you return `undefined` until all required data is loaded, then return the full object once.
rule.instructions: - Use `select` in useCoState when loading nested data - Return `undefined` while data is loading - Return the full object only when all required data is loaded - This batches all progressive loads into a single render

rule.name: Selectors vs useMemo for Expensive Operations
rule.description: Don't perform expensive computations inside selectors. Use lightweight selectors + useMemo instead.
rule.rationale: Selectors run on EVERY CoValue update, even if equalityFn prevents re-renders. Expensive operations in selectors execute unnecessarily on every update.
rule.instructions: - Keep selectors lightweight: only check loading state and extract simple values - For expensive computations (sorting, filtering, grouping), use useMemo outside the selector - Use stable dependency arrays in useMemo (like IDs) to control when recomputation happens - This ensures expensive work only runs when data actually changes, not on every Jazz update

rule.name: Progressive Loading is the Default
rule.description: Jazz loads nested data progressively, not all at once. Understand this to avoid performance pitfalls.
rule.rationale: When you specify deep resolve structures, Jazz loads objects level-by-level. Each level loaded triggers a new object reference, which triggers React re-renders if not handled with selectors.

loading_behavior.step: 4. Continue until all resolve depth is loaded
loading_behavior.impact: Each step creates a new object reference

rule.instructions: - Progressive loading is a feature, not a bug - Use selectors to control when components see the data - Don't fight progressive loading with React patterns (useEffect, useState) - Embrace Jazz reactivity instead of React state management

rule.name: Performance: Load What You Need, When You Need It
rule.description: Optimize Jazz loading by loading data on-demand, not all upfront. Load current view's data, not all 18 holes.

loading_strategy.strategy: Initial load: Load minimal data needed for first render
Current view: Load only data for current screen/hole/tab
On-demand: Use ensureLoaded() when user navigates to new sections
Shallow first: Load lists shallowly, then load individual items as needed

performance_impact.wrong_way: Loading 18 holes × 2 teams × 2 rounds = 72+ objects = slow
performance_impact.right_way: Loading 1 hole × 2 teams × 2 rounds = 4 objects = fast

rule.instructions: Don't over-fetch data. Load only what the current view needs, load more as user navigates.

rule.name: Circular Dependencies with String IDs
rule.description: Avoid circular dependencies between CoMaps by using string IDs instead of direct references.

examples.example: // Round uses playerId: z.string() instead of player: Player // Player can have rounds: co.optional(ListOfRounds)

rule.instructions: When two entities would reference each other, use string IDs in one direction to break the circular dependency.

rule.name: Jazz API Patterns
rule.description: Common Jazz API patterns for working with data

api_patterns.pattern: Delete optional fields: `obj.$jazz.delete("field")` - MUST use delete, not set(undefined)

rule.instructions: Use these standard Jazz patterns consistently across the codebase.

rule.name: Delete vs Set Undefined for Optional Fields
rule.description: Use $jazz.delete() to remove optional fields, NOT $jazz.set(field, undefined)
rule.rationale: Setting a field to undefined keeps the key on the object with value undefined. Deleting removes the key entirely. UI checks like `field !== undefined` behave differently for each.
rule.instructions: - Always use $jazz.delete("field") to remove optional fields - Never use $jazz.set("field", undefined) to "clear" a field - The distinction matters for UI checks, schema validation, and data integrity

rule.name: Debugging Loading Issues
rule.description: Tools for debugging Jazz loading problems

debugging_tools.tool: `$isLoaded` - Check if object is fully loaded
`$jazz.loadingState` - Check loading state (undefined = not tried yet)
`$jazz.has("field")` - Check if optional field exists in DB

rule.instructions: When data isn't loading as expected, check loadingState and $isLoaded to diagnose the issue.

rule.name: Jazz Inspect CLI Tool
rule.description: Use the jazz-inspect CLI script to debug Jazz CoValues directly

commands.command: bun run jazz <coValueId> - Inspect any CoValue by ID
bun run jazz <coValueId> '{"rounds":{"$each":true}}' - Inspect with resolve query

rule.usage: Run from packages/web directory. Uses worker credentials from packages/api/.env. Pass a CoValue ID (co_xxx) and optionally a JSON resolve query. Outputs: field values, $jazz.has() status, raw object keys.
rule.instructions: Use this tool to inspect CoValues when debugging data issues. It connects directly to Jazz cloud using the worker account.

rule.name: CoRecord Map Access: Use Direct Access, Not $jazz.has()
rule.description: For CoRecord maps (co.record()), use map[key] and check null/undefined. Do NOT use $jazz.has(key).
rule.rationale: Maps with resolve: {map: {}} load structure but not all items. Direct access is reliable, $jazz.has() is not.
rule.instructions: - $jazz.has("field"): ONLY for optional fields on CoMaps - $jazz.has(key): NEVER for checking CoRecord map key existence - CoRecord maps: const item = map[key]; if (item) {...} - Item may be unloaded reference - OK to store in other CoMaps

rule.name: Storing Unloaded References
rule.description: Unloaded CoMap references can be stored in other CoMaps. Cast to co.loaded<typeof T> to satisfy TypeScript.
rule.instructions: - Don't load references just to store them - Cast: as co.loaded<typeof T> for TypeScript - Jazz lazy-loads when accessed

rule.name: Map Loading Levels
rule.description: resolve: {map: {}} loads map structure (keys accessible). Does NOT load items. Use resolve: {map: {"co.items": {}}} to load all items (expensive).
rule.instructions: - resolve: {players: {}} - can iterate keys, items may be unloaded - resolve: {players: {"co.items": {}}} - loads all items (avoid for large maps) - Access items directly when needed, load on-demand

rule.name: Jazz Documentation
rule.description: Jazz Tools documentation is available at https://jazz.tools/docs and via Context7 MCP
rule.instructions: For detailed Jazz Tools API documentation, check https://jazz.tools/docs or use the Context7 MCP to fetch library docs.
